text: 750ml bottle. Cloudy, orangey golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Woody vanilla aroma, minimally bready, malty background. Taste is sweet-ish, bready malty, slightly dry woody, predominant notes of vanilla. Slightly monotonous and widely disguised under a vanilla coat.

Bottle thanks to Richthevillan, cheers Rich. Hazy amber beer with small head. Aroma is malts, vanilla, wood and bourbon with some spice. Taste is bourbon barrel, yeast, malts, stewed fruits, some sweetness, vanilla and some booze. Medium sticky body. Excellent stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Bacchanalia, Cambridge. This is the first cloudwater beer i have genuinely liked, which is odd as it is not a style i have much love for. Pours cloudy orAnd with an off white head. Malt, yeast and caramel aroma. Bourbon is there, but subtle. Two things stick out; first, combination was pretty soft and not the fizzy nightmare you often get with the style. Second, there is some sweetness, but it is quite subtle and tinged with bourbon vanilla, i.e. not that in your face bubblegum sweetness you get from some more traditional versions. Viscous, oily texture with some nice bitterness. Really good stuff.

Bottle. Bier Huis, Osset. Pale copper colour. Thin, dense, lasting, sticky, off white head. Looks great. Nose has toffee apple. Caramel and fudge. Granary bread. Plenty of boozy esters. Some notes of the bourbon barrel. Sweet and oaky vanilla. Taste is sweet and estery. Some bourbon oomph. Soft and silky mouthfeel. Perfect carbonation, despite the description. Drinks well under the ABV. More of the vanilla on the finish. Lovely stuff.

Bottle from Bridgend Services, Freuchie. Pours pretty clear. Lovely bright amber. Sunburst finish. Creamy white head that really clings to the glass. Aroma has a definite, lightly toasted coconut vibe. Quite Sorachi-like. Herbal. Lemon. Pineapple is there too. Toffee fudge. A touch of wood and booze but not too hot. Taste has a bitter marmalde sweetness. A little brown sugar toffee but is quickly taken over by loads of peppery booze. Dry with rye. Fruit follows. Coconut and pineapple smoothie. Smooth and beautifully full mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Fruity, bitter and warming finish. Interesting. One to savour.

Bottle split at L42, Syndicate share, 23/01/17.
Lightly hazed golden orange with a decent off white head that soon dissipates edgeward.
Nose is sweet , light oak tones, subtle bourbon whiff, caramel, fruit esters.
Taste comprises caramel, fruit pudding, bourbon well evident, light sugar melt, candyfloss, tangy fruit whack.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the close.
Solid for style, decent balance if perhaps a touch bourbon heavy.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 23rd January 2017Level 42 Bottleshare. Thanks to the team! Lightly hazy gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Soft malts, smooth. Lovely light sweet floral vibe, champagne too. Very light bourbon and oaky vanilla. Smooth finish brings a.modicum of spice and leaves a soothing warmth. Was expecting BBA muscle and got a very smooth and nuanced beer. Very nice.

75cl bottle shared at Level 42. It pours a clean rich golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is sweet fruity with plenty notes of stone fruit and vanilla bourbon notes. Taste is also rich and sweet with notes of vanilla bourbon melon stone fruits and some esters. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very good one

Bottle share at Canary Wharf, with many thanks to the team. As Cloudwater Bourbon BA Tripel, 10%. Hazy orange, still, foamy off-white head, full lacing. Aroma is airy, light vanilla cream, papery, bourbon. Body is quite light, frothy, soft carbonation. Taste is dusty, spicy, bourbon, clean and dry, quite light and a touch washed out by carbonation.

Bottle at level 42. It pours hazy orange - amber with a medium off-white head. The aroma is musty, farmyard, dirt, vanilla, oak, candy, nougat, icing sugar, bourbon, apple, melon and white grape. The taste is smooth, slick, white bread, pear, toffee apple, melon, vanilla, coconut, tapioca, bourbon fruit, sugary, apricot, white grape and candy with a sugary finish. Medium - full body and moderate, foamy carbonation. A bit sweet, but not bad.

Bottle shared in London - cheers to the crew. Pours mostly clear orange with a creamy, off-white head. Restrained aroma, with some orange peel, wheat bread, pale wood. Medium to big sweet flavour, interesting character, some tangerine, peach, honey, woody dryness, vanilla. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet and warming finish, oily, with more creamy vanilla, pale wood, nectarine, angel food cake. Great fun overall.

Bottle shared on Level 42 23/01/2017. Fron Eebria. A clear amber orange coloured pour a fine off white head. Aroma is woody oak, Bourbon, vanilla, . Not much more than Bourbon oak. Flavour is composed of woody oak, grapey fruits, semi sweet vanilla, little honey, . Hides the alcohol really well. Little alcohol bite in the finish. Palate is semi sweet, highish frothy carbonation, semi drying finish. I like it. Decent abbie yeast.

Bottle. Pours orange in color with a small white head. Sweet on the nose, part bourbon, part some tropical fruits. Quite nice. Vanilla spicyness and toffee too. Sweetish taste with some ripe fruits and bourbon infused toffee. Hints of bitterness on the side as well with a light spicy finish. Slightly vinous sweet end, alright though.
Taste from a bottle at home courtesy of Craig. Very cloudy. A golden colour. A bit tart.
Bottle from the dregs run delivery. Thanks Craig! Pours hazy golden. Aromas of orange, light funk, something sweet. Taste is quite sweet too. Not much tripel character left, but a nice beer.
Mega pozytywne zaskoczenie! Mało Bourbonu, ale za to bardzo fajne, oleiste ciało, dużo żółtych owoców, przypraw. Przypomina Stille Nacht.
Bottle at craigs. Pours golden orange, nose is caramel, toffee, orange, sugary, taste is sticky caramel, sweet, bourbon, flat.
Bottle at home... Golden amber.. Thin white lacing lacing.. Soft funk.. Light bourbon fruit.. Big funk nose.. Soft boozy fruit. Light funk.. Juicy yeasty fumk

Bottle thanks to cgarvieuk. 
Appearance - golden hazy with a thin head. 
Nose - marmalade. Dank. Funky.
Taste - more mark and funk. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a fairly good finish. 
Overall - .the sweetness erodes some of the tangy Tripel notes.
Bottle at Cotteridge wines tasting room; hazy golden yellow pour with a bubbly beige head, aroma vinous action, taste has sweet caramel, hints of bourbon, tinned sweet pineapple.

75cl bottle between five at the Dec 2016 Shrewsbury Beer Exchange Group meeting in Chez Sophie; thanks Paolo for this one. Poured cloudy golden orange, decent white head. Aroma is fruity with a bourbon and vanilla trace alongside a spicy hint. Taste is semi-sweet with the fruitiness from the nose disappearing with the bourbon and vanilla taking over, still a spicy feel too. Liked it.

75cl bottle @ monthly tasting, Chez Sophie, courtesy of Paolo. Pours hazy orange, thin white head. Aroma is pleasant, light bourbon / vanilla / spice sweetness. Taste is smooth, well-integrated bourbon sweetness with the tripel yeast. Very well balanced, vibrant sweetness. Very good indeed.

Bottle shared during the November THT tasting at deansos place. Pours a hazy orange with an off-white head. Getting lots of the barrel notes and some yeasty funk. Flavour is full of fruitiness, sweet malty goodness, slight oak, vanilla, caramel. Medium body, low carbonation. This is an awesome variation on a tripel.

Bottle sample @ Vine Birre Ribelli 16. And Clouwater strikes again, phenomenal.
Dorée, col blanc.
Arôme intense mais offrant un savant alliage entre le bouquet belge, qui se note via la levure, et le Bourbon qui apporte de fines effluves de vanille en rétro. Retrouve un houblonné plutôt noble dans le fleuri et léger citronné.
Palais est plaisant et complexe, le tout offre assez de caractère du Bourbon tout en gardant la base belge dune triple bien maitrisée. Lusage de chêne américain offre aussi cette pointe de douceur avec une petite pointe de sucre résiduel tirant vers le style abbaye belge. Lamertume reste plus en retrait.

750 ml. bottle sampled @ Vini Birre Ribelli 2016. Dark orange, little white head. Nose is pleasant sweet bourbon caramel sweet bourbon, lower than usual vanilla oak, mandarin, yeast profile is more DE than BE for me, low fish guts yeast, probably different brewing process and/or yeast than most Belgians. Taste is sweet bourbon, fish guts DE yeast profile, caramel, boozy lingering finish, caramel & marzipan, caramel malts, lighty boozy bourbon finish. Body is yeast, boozy slick bourbon caramel malts. Bourbon really saves this beer & lifts it up, quite good now but without the bourbon covering it all up, it wouldnt be as stellar I feel.
Pours rather clear blonde, small White head. Smell is sweet, some bourbon. Taste is full, Sharp, bourbon. Bit sweet, mild bitterness. Some dough, some vanilla.
Bottle shared at the November THT at deansos place. Gusher. Hazy orange with a white head. Notes of bourbon, spices, light tropical fruit, brett bitterness, caramel, vanilla and oak.
Auf der Biermesse in BXL getrunken. Trübes Gelborange im Glas. In der Nase intensive Fassnoten. Ein Tripel, das sehr gewonnen hat.

Bottle shared. Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of yeast, oak barrel, bourbon, vanilla, yeast, pineapple and caramel. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at Novembers Tht.
Thin white head. Very hazy golden pour. Very good.

Sampled from bottle at "This is not really deansos last THT"-tasting. Hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, lots of herbs and vanilla. Yes its strong but not alcoholic in aroma. Citrus fruity, some pineapplejuice as well. Medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, yoghurty texture and low carbonation. Funky brew, like it!

Sampled from bottle @ Benzais final THT although MrHangover thinks its something else. Gusher. Hazy orange color, average sized white to off-white head. Aroma is hard to describe. Weird and slightly fruity hints perhaps..? Taste sweetish, lightly bourbon, slightly a hint of fruit. Decent to medium body and carbonation. Decent.

Tap. Hazy amber body with a small off-white head. Aroma of yeast, caramel, fruity notes, wood, vanilla, coconut and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice and complex Tripel. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar (Aarhus), Jaegergaardsgade 61, ST., DK-8000 Aarhus, Denmark. [ As Cloudwater Bourbon BA Tripel ].Unclear medium amber orange color with a small, frothy to fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, moderate to heavy yeasty, sweet yeast, bourbon, vanilla, coconut. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, bourbon, vanilla, sweet malt, coconut, laber larver, caramel. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20161028]

On tap.
Pours a dark amber with full head.
Aromas of fruity champagne with apricot and peach and maybe some wood.
Flavors of fizzy muddled fruit almost like cotton candy with a bit of Belgian yeast and white wine on a sturdy malt base. 
Neat!

Gylden klar skum hvid kort 
Citrus malt vaijle træ 
Bitter lidtvsød moderate 
Oile fald 
@mikkkeller år

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy bourbon woody aroma with weak yeasty hints. Fruity malty spicy peppery woody bourbon flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy bourbon woody finish.

Tap. Pours clear bronze with a small white head. Aromas of vanilla, fudge, dark fruits, belgian yeast, sweeter light fruits, coconut. Taste is bourbony, vanilla, fudge, malts, caramel, sweet syrupy, belgian fruity esters.
Pour light amber with a small white head. Aroma of vanilla, caramel, booze oak, and bourbon. Taste light sweet. Medium bodied. Soft to average carbonation

From tap at Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours a clearish amber with a small white head. Aroma has looots of coconut, bourbon, vanilla, sweeter fruits like pineapple, toasted caramel malts. Taste is sweet, vanilla, slight oaky, toooons of bourbon. Light carbonation and a full body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours hazy orange amber with an off white head. Aroma of sweet esters, dark sweet fruits, weak bourbon notes and slight fudge. Taste is sweet with notes of bourbon, sweet esters, spices and caramel.
Draft. An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, bourbon, caramel, and fruit. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and bourbon, leading to a dry alcoholic finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of bourbon, oak, vanilla, sweet caramel, fruity esters. Clear caramel brown colour with white head, not lasting. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter. Full body, sticky syrupy feel, sweet bourbon finish.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Cloudy orange colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, spices with notes of whisky.
Fruity flavor of caramel and spices with notes of bourbon.
Fruity finish.
From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a small tan head. Toasted malty and caramelish. Lingering wooden malty. Slight herbal. Toasted malty finish.

Medium sweet malty with notes of dried fruit and some spices, sprinkling of subtle coconut, nice resonating bourbon infused wooden notes into the close.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, wood and lots of bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with lots of warming alcohol. Oily. 211016

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Hazy dark amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, coconut, bourbon and vanilla. Flavour is malt, caramel, bourbon, yeast, vanilla, sweet, warming, notes of alcohol, hop and a little orange peel.

Draught @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Pours dark golden with an offwhite head, light lacings. Aorma of malt, wood, vanilla, coconut, bourbon, fruit, pineapple, alcohol. Flavor is rather sweet, malt, bourbon, vanilla, coconut, alcohol. Medium to full body, average carbonation, light sweet finish with warming alcohol. 211016
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good suration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are coconut, pineapple, wood, vanilla, malt and hops. Sweet finish.
Duft sød vanilje karamel, smagsødvanilje lidt appelsin likør malt svag kokus

Belgian yeast, red wine, Iggy citrus fruits. Hazy gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light sweet. Sweet caramel, toffee, wheat and other sweet grain, alcohol, a touch of coconut, dark fruits, soft carbonation, light sweet finish. Bit of a let down in the aroma, but man, nice palate. Bottle from the brewery, Manchester.
